message.content:
cs.CR, cs.DC, cs.GT, cs.LG, cs.NE 

This paper discusses the decentralization of blockchain technologies, which is a topic that falls under several computer science sub-categories. The most likely category is cs.CR (Cryptography and Security), as the paper discusses the security implications of decentralization in blockchain systems. The second most likely category is cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing), as the paper focuses on quorum-based approaches to consensus in decentralized systems. The third likely category is cs.GT (Computer Science and Game Theory), as the paper draws from game theory to establish limiting results concerning decentralization. The fourth likely category is cs.LG (Machine Learning), as the paper proposes a novel methodology to formalize and quantitatively analyze decentralization in blockchain systems. The fifth likely category is cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing), as the paper discusses the potential for blockchain systems to evolve towards greater decentralization over time.
